statement:
In this entry, the class number of a number field $F$ is denoted by
$h_F$.

Let $p$ be a fixed prime number.

-   Let $F/K$ be a Galois extension with Galois group
    ${\operatorname{Gal}}(F/K)$ and suppose $F/K$ is a $p$-extension (so
    ${\operatorname{Gal}}(F/K)$ is a $p$-group). Assume that there is at
    most one prime or archimedean place which ramifies in $F/K$. If
    $h_F$ is divisible by $p$ then $h_K$ is also divisible by $p$.\

-   Let $F/{\mathbb{Q}}$ be a Galois extension of the rational numbers
    and assume that ${\operatorname{Gal}}(F/{\mathbb{Q}})$ is a
    $p$-group and at most one place (finite or infinite) ramifies then
    $h_F$ is not divisible by $p$.
